intro: Plagiobothrys scopulorum, commonly known as the rock bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils, often in coastal or mountainous regions. It has hairy, narrow leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
